meanings.definition: A sudden intense feeling of fear
meanings.sent1: The loud thunderstorm caused a fright in the little girl.
meanings.sent2: The horror movie gave me a fright last night.
meanings.sent3: The prankster jumped out and gave his friend a fright.
meanings.sent4: The eerie silence in the haunted house sent a fright down my spine.
meanings.sent5: The unexpected scream in the dark alley was a fright I won't forget.

meanings.definition: To make someone afraid or anxious
meanings.sent1: The sudden noise can frighten the birds away.
meanings.sent2: The ghost stories always frighten the young campers.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat loves to frighten the mice in the barn.
meanings.sent4: The howling wind can frighten even the bravest of souls.
meanings.sent5: The shadowy figure lurking in the corner can frighten anyone passing by.

meanings.sent1: I start to fright when I hear strange noises at night.
meanings.sent2: The child began to fright when left alone in the dark room.
meanings.sent3: The puppy would fright at the sight of a vacuum cleaner.
meanings.sent4: The thought of failing the test made him fright all night.
meanings.sent5: The dark forest made the hiker fright with every rustle of leaves.
